biography.value:
One of the few consolations available to those who must contend with a mind flayer colony is the limit of its reach, which spreads only as far as the influence of the colony’s elder brain. But this small solace withers away when a colony manages to capture a dragon. Teams of mind flayers bind the dragon, which is subject to a gruesome transformation as the elder brain latches onto the dragon’s back and digs its tentacles into the dragon’s brain. An elder brain dragon is the nightmarish result.

Using the mobility of the dragon’s body, the elder brain can now serve as a powerful general to illithid armies, free from the confines of its brine pool. The elder brain dragon becomes a psychic threat in addition to a physical one, its body rife with aberrant influence and pulsing with psionic power. Even the elder brain dragon’s breath weapon mutates during its transformation, becoming a stream of briny liquid roiling with illithid tadpoles. These tadpoles can swiftly slay victims and transform them into mind flayers, allowing the elder brain dragon to grow its own roving colony.

description.value:
The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} makes one Bite attack, two Claw attacks, and one Tentacle attack.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 2d10 + @mod type=piercing average=true]] damage plus [[/damage 2d10 type=psychic average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 1d6 + @mod type=slashing average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach 15 ft., one creature. Hit: [[/damage 1d8 + @mod type=psychic average=true]] damage. If the target is Huge or smaller, it is &Reference[grappled]{grappled} (escape DC 18). The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} can have up to four targets &Reference[grappled]{grappled} at a time.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} exhales brine in a 120-foot &Reference[line]{line} that is 15 feet wide. Each creature in that area must make a [[/save con 22 format=long]], taking [[/damage 10d10 type=psychic average=true]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On a success or failure, if the creature isn’t a &Reference[construct]{Construct} or an &Reference[undead]{Undead}, it becomes infested with illithid tadpoles.

While infested, the creature takes [[/damage 3d10 type=psychic average=true]] damage at the start of each of its turns. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself after it succeeds on three of these saves. If the creature is targeted by magic that ends a curse or restores 40 hit points or more, the tadpoles infesting the creature are killed instantly, ending the effect on the creature.

If a &Reference[humanoid]{Humanoid} is reduced to 0 hit points while infested, the creature is stable but remains &Reference[unconscious]{unconscious} for 6d12 hours. When the period of unconsciousness ends, the creature transforms into a mind flayer (see the Monster Manual) with all its hit points. Casting a wish spell on the &Reference[unconscious]{unconscious} creature rids it of the infestation and prevents it from turning into a mind flayer.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach 15 ft., one creature. Hit: [[/damage 1d8 + @mod type=psychic average=true]] damage. If the target is Huge or smaller, it is &Reference[grappled]{grappled} (escape DC 18). The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} can have up to four targets &Reference[grappled]{grappled} at a time.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

Tentacle. The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} makes one Tentacle attack.

Shatter &Reference[concentration]{Concentration} (Costs 2 Actions). The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} targets a creature it is grappling. The target’s &Reference[concentration]{concentration} on a spell it has cast or an ability it is maintaining ends, and the target takes [[/damage 3d12 type=psychic average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} targets a creature it is grappling. The target’s &Reference[concentration]{concentration} on a spell it has cast or an ability it is maintaining ends, and the target takes [[/damage 3d12 type=psychic average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Legendary Resistance (4/Day). If the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Siege Monster. The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} deals double damage to objects and structures.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Unusual &Reference[nat]{Nature}. The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} doesn’t require air or sleep.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].
